meanings.definition: A container typically made of glass or plastic, used for storing liquids.
meanings.sent1: I filled the bottle with water from the tap.
meanings.sent2: The store sells bottles of soda and juice.
meanings.sent3: When the bottle fell, it made a loud clinking sound.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter bubbled out like soda from a shaken bottle.
meanings.sent5: The bottle gleamed in the sunlight, tempting me with its contents.

meanings.sent1: She will bottle the homemade jam for sale.
meanings.sent2: The workers bottle the fresh milk every morning.
meanings.sent3: I will bottle my excitement until the surprise party.
meanings.sent4: He bottled his emotions, not wanting to show weakness.
meanings.sent5: The chef carefully bottled the fragrant olive oil for preservation.

meanings.definition: To hold in or as if in a bottle.
meanings.sent1: She bottled up her anger and smiled instead.
meanings.sent2: The memories were bottled inside him, waiting to be released.
meanings.sent3: Don't bottle your creativity; let it flow freely.
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm was bottled up, ready to explode at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The tension in the room was bottled, waiting for someone to break it.
